meanings.definition: One of the lateral lobes of a polychaete segment, bearing setae.
meanings.sent1: The parapodium helps the polychaete move around.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the structure of the parapodium in the polychaete.
meanings.sent3: The parapodium of the polychaete waved hello to the other segments.
meanings.sent4: The parapodium was like a tiny arm reaching out from the polychaete.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the parapodium made it stand out among the segments.

meanings.definition: A lateral extension of the foot in certain gastropods.
meanings.sent1: The gastropod used its parapodium to explore the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The parapodium of the gastropod helped it glide gracefully over the sand.
meanings.sent3: The curious parapodium of the gastropod wiggled playfully.
meanings.sent4: The parapodium of the gastropod was like a delicate leaf in the water.
meanings.sent5: The parapodium of the gastropod was a marvel of nature's design.

meanings.definition: A lateral extension of the body in certain arthropods.
meanings.sent1: The arthropod's parapodium provided stability as it crawled.
meanings.sent2: The parapodium of the arthropod was essential for balance on uneven surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The arthropod's parapodium accidentally knocked over a tiny rock.
meanings.sent4: The parapodium of the arthropod was like a tiny wing helping it navigate.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the parapodium of the arthropod fascinated the observer.
